<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 2"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Pactbound Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=3414) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=137" />
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
<trait label="Dedication" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=41" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Monsters of Myth](/Sources.aspx?ID=107) pg. 10</row>

**Archetype** [Pactbound Initiate](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=167)

**Prerequisites**
Trained in [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10)

</column>

---

You befriended one of the last saumen kar and were infused with a fraction of their power, granting you the potential to become a guardian of their ancient pact. You gain [cold](/Traits.aspx?ID=27) resistance equal to half your level. You can [Hide](/Actions.aspx?ID=62) and [Sneak](/Actions.aspx?ID=63) while it's snowing even lightly, even if it wouldn't be thick enough to normally grant [concealment](/Conditions.aspx?ID=4). Finally, all saumen kar can sense the mark of their pact upon you, and their attitude toward you is typically one step better than it would be otherwise ([hostile](/Conditions.aspx?ID=23) to [unfriendly](/Conditions.aspx?ID=40), unfriendly to [indifferent](/Conditions.aspx?ID=25), etc.) Most saumen kar are unfriendly to outsiders; this would make them indifferent to you.

**Special** You can't select another dedication feat until you've gained two other feats from the pactbound initiate archetype.

<title level="2">Pactbound Dedication leads to...</title>
[Crown of the Saumen Kar](/Feats.aspx?ID=3416), [Frostbite Runes](/Feats.aspx?ID=3417), [Ice Crafter](/Feats.aspx?ID=3415)
name: Pactbound Dedication
